name: places/ChIJ_Qcikd73wokRIsvyKMKOn1w
adrFormatAddress: 2632 Broadway, New York, NY 10025-5021, USA

originalText.text: This is my story, I’m disappointment, I took my granddaughter to get acrylic nails to look nice for back to school and the technician Ms. Judy did a horrible job. Firstmost, she was rude and hesitant about doing the acrylic nails over again. Never going back this place is unprofessional. Sadly, wasted my money not worth it the nails popped out in 3 days. Sloppy job. Beware ladies!

originalText.text:
I did gel pedicure and gel manicure here
It hurt a lot when the lady was cutting my dead skin, and now I’m bleeding badly

My worst experience

originalText.text: Rushed and the most crooked French manicure I ever had. I’m paying to get them redone elsewhere. NEVER AGAIN.

text.text: Rushed and the most crooked French manicure I ever had. I’m paying to get them redone elsewhere. NEVER AGAIN.

originalText.text: Bright, welcoming salon with lots of nice nail polish colors. I was a walk-in on a quiet afternoon. They have a special mani/pedi deal for $38, but I just wanted a pedicure ($29). The woman who was sitting at the first table took me to the back where the foot baths were. She was sweet, quiet, focused, meticulous and efficient. The pedicure went smoothly and was so relaxing. A quick and gentle foot/calf scrub she gave me during the process felt wonderful. My toes look great! They work hard. Tip well. Highly recommend.

text.text: Bright, welcoming salon with lots of nice nail polish colors. I was a walk-in on a quiet afternoon. They have a special mani/pedi deal for $38, but I just wanted a pedicure ($29). The woman who was sitting at the first table took me to the back where the foot baths were. She was sweet, quiet, focused, meticulous and efficient. The pedicure went smoothly and was so relaxing. A quick and gentle foot/calf scrub she gave me during the process felt wonderful. My toes look great! They work hard. Tip well. Highly recommend.

originalText.text:
The service started off ok but my nail tech was abruptly switched out when another customer came in (without any sort of communication) and it was downhill from there.

I received their mani/pedi bundle from what looked like the owner (she was sitting behind the counter when me and my mother arrived) who was not kind or courteous at all. She was stand off-ish, abrasive, and during the middle of my service she stopped and demanded that I pay right away.

My mother received a completely different treatment, however. When she told the nail tech that she was paying for the service, they told her payment upfront was no longer required. To top it all off, when my mother upgraded her standard manicure to a gel manicure, they were kinder and  friendlier, and even gave her a complimentary massage. I didn’t get any of this warmth nor did I receive a massage.

To top it all off, my nails were not completely coated, and after two days I’m already starting to see signs of fading.

Since the staff is selective to who they want to be nice to, the nail polish doesn’t last long, and they prioritize people who spend more money, I would recommend getting your nails done someplace where they’re more appreciative.
